text:
Read the information carefully, then use it to answer the question that follows.

Jack, Chioma, India, Ellen and Kwasi all completed a maths quiz. Jack didn’t get the lowest score. Kwasi scored more than Jack. India’s score was lower than Ellen’s. Chioma got the second highest score.

Which of the sentences below must be true?
explanation:
Answer:

‘India got the lowest score.’ is correct. Jack didn’t get the lowest score and Kwasi scored more than Jack, so Kwasi didn’t get the lowest score either. India’s score was lower than Ellen’s, so Ellen didn’t get the lowest score. Chioma got the second highest score. Since no one else could have got the lowest score, India must have got the lowest score.

text:

Patrick, Sue, Ophelia, Maleek and Rita have learnt some swimming strokes.
Patrick, Maleek and Ophelia can do breaststroke. No one but Sue can do butterfly. Everyone but Ophelia can do backstroke, but Ophelia can do front crawl. Maleek can also do front crawl. Rita can do two swimming strokes.

Who can do the most swimming strokes?
explanation:
Answer:

Patrick, Sue, Ophelia and Rita can do two swimming strokes. Maleek can do three swimming strokes.

text:
In this question, one letter can be moved from the first word to the second word to make two
new words.
The letters must not otherwise be rearranged and both new words must make sense.
Find the letter that moves and mark it on the answer sheet.
Example pound or
A p B o C u D n E d
Answer u
Solution The answer is u: when removed from the word ‘pound’, we get a new word
‘pond’ and when added to the word ‘or’ we get a new word ‘our’. The letters
have not otherwise been rearranged and both new words make sense.

metal though

144 ÷ 6 Æ 3 = 72 ÷ 8 Æ [ ? ] Three of these four words are given in code. The codes are not written in the same order as the words and one code is missing. NAIL FIND LATE FIST 3752 5674 4689 which letter. Begin by focusing on one number which appears more than once. If this number appears in the same position in two of the codes, you might be able to spot the same pattern with the letters. If not, compare the positions of your chosen letter and see if this is reflected in the words. For example, the number 7 appears in 2nd position in the first code (3752) and 3rd position in the second code (5674). Looking at the 2nd letters of the words, I is the one letter that also appears in 3rd position in a word, so the letter I must be represented by the number 7 and so on. Once we’ve substituted these letters into the remaining number codes, we can work out what a few more numbers stand for. Knowing that 4=L (from NAIL), we can tell that 4689 stands for LATE and, therefore, that 8=T and 9=E. Looking at the third and final number code, 3752, we can conclude that 3=F because the two remaining words both begin with F. This helps to establish what other letters stand for and answer further questions on missing words or codes. Choose the correct answer and mark it on the answer sheet.
explanation: The correct answer is 18.

Jack, Chioma, India, Ellen and Kwasi all completed a maths quiz. Jack didn’t get the lowest score. Kwasi scored more than Jack. India’s score was lower than Ellen’s. Chioma got the second highest score.

Which of the sentences below must be true?
explanation:
Answer:

‘India got the lowest score.’ is correct. Jack didn’t get the lowest score and Kwasi scored more than Jack, so Kwasi didn’t get the lowest score either. India’s score was lower than Ellen’s, so Ellen didn’t get the lowest score. Chioma got the second highest score. Since no one else could have got the lowest score, India must have got the lowest score.

text:
Read the information carefully, then choose the correct answer to the question that follows.

Patrick, Sue, Ophelia, Maleek and Rita have learnt some swimming strokes.
Patrick, Maleek and Ophelia can do breaststroke. No one but Sue can do butterfly. Everyone but Ophelia can do backstroke, but Ophelia can do front crawl. Maleek can also do front crawl. Rita can do two swimming strokes.

Who can do the most swimming strokes?
explanation:
Answer:

Patrick, Sue, Ophelia and Rita can do two swimming strokes. Maleek can do three swimming strokes.

text:
Read the information carefully, then use it to answer the question that follows.

Jack, Chioma, India, Ellen and Kwasi all completed a maths quiz. Jack didn’t get the lowest score. Kwasi scored more than Jack. India’s score was lower than Ellen’s. Chioma got the second highest score.

Which of the sentences below must be true?
explanation:
Answer:

‘India got the lowest score.’ is correct. Jack didn’t get the lowest score and Kwasi scored more than Jack, so Kwasi didn’t get the lowest score either. India’s score was lower than Ellen’s, so Ellen didn’t get the lowest score. Chioma got the second highest score. Since no one else could have got the lowest score, India must have got the lowest score.
